body_content.explanation: a group of people who admire and support a person very strongly and agree with what he or she says or does:
examples: Even in her darkest hours Margaret Thatcher had her passionate advocates, her loud claque of admirers.

body_content.explanation: in the past, a group of people who were paid to applaud (= show approval of) a performer or performers, for example in the theatre:
examples: Such people are the 21st-century equivalent of the claque, paid not with cash but with an invitation to the post-show party.
